page.title: 19GEOGRAPHICAL DESCRIPTION p1.
page.content:
The study area is situated in West Central Scotland and is cut by the River Clyde. The valley changes dramatically in character from east to west, from a broad, flat, open flood_plain recently reclaimed for recreational use as Strathclyde Country Park, to a deeper, narrower, gorge_like section which, in the past, offered an ideal site for a water powered cotton mill, and is now protected as a Site of Special Scientific Interest. The lands bordering the river are rolling lowlands (maximum height c75m) covered with glacial and riverine deposits of clay and sand. The landscape offers variety and contrast, urban and rural, industrial and agricultural, old and new.
{Continued on p20
